item.title: From Bitcoin Trading Bot to Docker Caddy Server Setup
item.description: Building and Evolving My Personal Server: From Naive Trading Bots to a Streamlined Docker Setup with Caddy Back in 2017, I embarked on an exciting (and somewhat naive) adventure when I created my first personal server (a $2.50/month instance on Vultr). It was a modest setup—just half a shared CPU, 512 MB of RAM, and 10 GB of SSD storage—but at the time, it felt like more than enough for my needs.

item.title: Self-Hosting a Firefox Sync Server
item.description: After switching from Firefox to LibreWolf, I became interested in the idea of self-hosting my own Firefox Sync server. Although I had seen this was possible before, I had never really looked into it—until now. I embarked on a journey to set this up, and while it wasn’t completely smooth sailing, I eventually got it working. Here’s how it went. Finding the Right Sync Server Initial Search: Mozilla’s Sync Server Repo I started by searching for “firefox sync server github” and quickly found Mozilla’s syncserver repo.
